column4: debian is way older than Ubuntu, debian uses the oldest packages out of all distros out there

I went and bought another agp, and put it in, and installed proprietary nvidia drivers.  It was horrible, my case was left open, cause it is small form factor, and use the card didn't fit with the case on, and on top of that, my cpu was running so high all the time
Then I remembered that long time ago, when I was running debian on this computer, I ran compiz, so I tried again, and sure enough, it installed and so far it running goood
It runs, but it crashes sometimes, so Ubuntu blacklisted it.  But it seems ok so far for me.  We'll see
There is something fishy about nvidia proprietary drivers, they kill cpu
: Nvidia works fine for me..nothing fishy.
: Nvidia 3rd Card?
yep
: model ?
its an old one, gforce I think, 128mb
it doesn't say on the card, but when I had it in, I think that was the driver
: I use Geforce 7200
: I use Geforce 7200 256mb
hmm, so what do you think about my issue of cpu over use.  It was constanly loaded, and now its stays under a quarter, before it was always at 3 quarter(75%)
and 3d is on now too
: Ubuntu 10.04 ?
no, I had to switch for the video driver
debian 5
: Why don't you try Debian Channel : There they will be more familiar with this problem.
I don't have a problem, I was just chit chatting
: I haven't use Debian ; how does it compare with Ubuntu

well, on my laptop, I could get power management(sleep and hibernate) working, but it worked out of the box with ubuntu, but on my desktop, it was the reverse, i can't sleep with ubuntu, but it works with debian
